title: User query: Plan description from client LLM
log: Make a plan that return organisation names and the number of departments that they have. I want the output in descending order and outputted in a textfile.

title: Agent: SpecifierAgent Output
log:
Create a Wayang plan that:
- Reads the input dataset containing organisation records and their departments.
- Groups records by organisation name and counts the number of distinct departments per organisation.
- Sorts the organisations in descending order by their department count.
- Writes the result (organisation name and department count) to a text file.

log.thoughts: To compute organisation names and the number of departments per organisation I need the organisation table for organisation.name and organisation.organisation_id, and the department table for department.organisation_id to count departments. No text files are required.

steps.detailed_description: Load the JDBC tables 'organisation' and 'department' as inputs. Read all columns from organisation (organisation_id, organisation_no, active_organisation, name, social_housing_org, municipality) and all columns from department (department_id, organisation_id, name, operation_center, esyn). Output: two input datasets named organisation and department.

Join the department dataset with the organisation dataset on organisation.organisation_id = department.organisation_id to associate each department with its organisation name. Input: datasets 'organisation' and 'department'. Output: joined dataset containing at least organisation.name and department.department_id (and department.name).

From the joined dataset, group records by organisation.name and compute the number of distinct departments per organisation by counting distinct department.department_id (or distinct department.name if department_id is null). Then sort the resulting (organisation.name, department_count) pairs in descending order by department_count. Input: joined dataset. Output: sorted aggregated dataset with columns 'name' (organisation name) and 'department_count' (integer).

Write the final sorted aggregated dataset (organisation name and department_count) to a text file. Each output line should contain organisation name and department_count (e.g., tab- or comma-separated as required). Input: sorted aggregated dataset from step 3. Output: text file result.

log.thoughts: Load both tables, join them to get organisation names per department, then perform a grouped distinct-count and sort, and finally write the result. Four steps (input, join, aggregate+sort, output) keep the plan minimal and clear.

title: Class: StepHandler created step dependencies and queue

log.thoughts: Loaded both JDBC tables as separate inputs. Kept outputs empty so subsequent steps can consume these datasets (ids 1 and 2).

operations.udf: (t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val org = t._1; val dept = t._2; val orgName = org.getField(3).toString; val deptId = dept.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int]; val deptName = dept.getField(2).toString; (orgName, deptId, deptName) }

log.thoughts: Loaded both JDBC tables as inputs (ids 1 and 2), joined on organisation_id (operator 3), and mapped to (organisation.name, department_id, department.name) as output (operator 4).

operations.udf: (t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val dept = t._1; val org = t._2; val orgName = if(org.getField(3) != null) org.getField(3).toString else ""; val deptId = if(dept.getField(0) != null) dept.getField(0).toString else ""; val deptName = if(dept.getField(2) != null) dept.getField(2).toString else ""; val deptIdent = if(deptId.nonEmpty) deptId else deptName; (orgName, deptIdent) }

(g: (String, java.lang.Iterable[(String, String)])) => { import scala.collection.JavaConverters._; val name = g._1; val iterable = g._2.asScala; val deptIdSet = iterable.map(_._2).toSet; (name, deptIdSet.size) }

log.thoughts: Loaded organisation and department via JDBC (ids 1-2), joined on organisation_id (3), mapped to (orgName, deptIdentifier) (4), grouped by orgName (5), counted distinct dept identifiers (6), and sorted descending by count (7).

operations.udf: (t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val org = t._1; val dept = t._2; val orgName = if(org.getField(3) == null) "" else org.getField(3).toString; val deptIdField = dept.getField(0); val deptId = if(deptIdField != null) deptIdField.toString else { val deptNameField = dept.getField(2); if(deptNameField != null) deptNameField.toString else "" }; (orgName, deptId) }
(t: (String, Int)) => { val key = t._1; val parts = key.split("\\\\|\\\\|"); val orgName = if(parts.length > 0) parts(0) else ""; (orgName, 1) }

log.thoughts: Loaded organisation and department via JDBC, joined on organisation_id (using Record access), extracted org name and department identifier, deduplicated departments per organisation, aggregated counts, sorted descending and prepared text output.

title: Class: StepHandler merged subplans to full plan

operations.udf: (t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val org = t._1; val dept = t._2; val orgName = if(org.getField(3) == null) "" else org.getField(3).toString; val deptIdField = dept.getField(0); val deptId = if(deptIdField != null) deptIdField.toString else { val deptNameField = dept.getField(2); if(deptNameField != null) deptNameField.toString else "" }; (orgName, deptId) }
(t: (String, Int)) => { val key = t._1; val parts = key.split("\\\\|\\\\|"); val orgName = if(parts.length > 0) parts(0) else ""; (orgName, 1) }

(t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val org = t._1; val dept = t._2; val orgName = if (org.getField(3) == null) "" else org.getField(3).toString; val deptIdField = dept.getField(0); val deptId = if (deptIdField != null) deptIdField.toString else { val deptNameField = dept.getField(2); if (deptNameField != null) deptNameField.toString else "" }; (orgName + "||" + deptId, 1) }
(t: (String, Int)) => { val key = t._1; val parts = key.split("\\|\\|"); val orgName = if(parts.length > 0) parts(0) else ""; (orgName, 1) }

log.thoughts: Kept the original logic but simplified intermediate steps: combined the composite key emission into one map (id 4), removed an extra redundant map by directly producing the composite key and counting distinct dept occurrences, ensured correct regex escaping for splitting the composite key, and verified join keys reference the proper organisation_id and department.organisation_id fields.

title: Class: PlanMapper Mapped the refined plan finalized for execution

data.table: (SELECT organisation_id, organisation_no, active_organisation, name, social_housing_org, municipality FROM organisation) as X
(SELECT department_id, organisation_id, name, operation_center, esyn FROM department) as X

data.udf: (t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val org = t._1; val dept = t._2; val orgName = if (org.getField(3) == null) "" else org.getField(3).toString; val deptIdField = dept.getField(0); val deptId = if (deptIdField != null) deptIdField.toString else { val deptNameField = dept.getField(2); if (deptNameField != null) deptNameField.toString else "" }; (orgName + "||" + deptId, 1) }
(t: (String, Int)) => { val key = t._1; val parts = key.split("\\|\\|"); val orgName = if(parts.length > 0) parts(0) else ""; (orgName, 1) }

title: Wayang: Wayang plan sent to Wayang
